head.supplied: 18th August 92 ¶ Dear Baron Mueller, ¶ ¶ It is only fair to you to tell you that I am very dissatisfied […] ¶ Meston's collection of Bellenden Ker [fruits] [bought] for £20. ¶ There were only about...

div.p: MRS 4/9/1005, Copies of correspondence sent: first series 1882-1921, Powerhouse Museum, Sydney.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
It is only fair to you to tell you that I am very dissatisfied […]
illegible — MS faded. Meston's collection of Bellenden Ker [fruits] [bought] for £20.
See J. Maiden to M, 23 June 1892. There were only about [half] a gallon altogether, few of them named, Mr Bailey tells me most of them were [windfalls], and that no attempt was made to obtain adequate botanical material […] them. A fair price would be [about] £5. They were got in the early part of the present year during a private [ex]cursion. As you know nothing of the circumstances, I think it is only proper you should know how Mr Meston has behaved.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
